text.content:
Except for rare cases (arrows stuck into the ground or lying on the shelf next to character etc.), characters need special containers for their ammunition.

For example, archers and crossbowmen need Quivers.

Handgunners need Powder Horns.

Mixing Improved Blackpowder

@UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.geiipKKwUUiREPAi]{Improved Blackpowder} (@UUID[JournalEntry.4spGTAnh7qc2JDqY.JournalEntryPage.TwuMMg4t9QPf89rT#alchemical-products]{Alchemy}) doesn't come with shots naturally.

For the purpose of Foundy, if you want for example a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shot and Powder} but with benefits of Improved Gunpowder, follow these rules:

  1. Make a copy of the @UUID[JournalEntry.2EGaOiGaaunZ2RuS.JournalEntryPage.SGWjMaw6OrZ06Nbp#loading-a-blackpowder-weapon]{ammunition item} you want to buy and mix.

  2. Reduce the price of the ammunition by 2 pennies per shot and pay the price (buying shots only).

  3. Open the @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.geiipKKwUUiREPAi]{Improved Gunpowder, Keg} item on the Effects tab.

  4. Drag both effects to the duplicated ammunition

  5. Edit the effects to enable "Apply to Actor"

  6. Decrease the amount of gunpowder in the keg by apropriate amount

Crafting Shots

Making shots can be done by someone with @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.wKwel9MG7NIG3i3w]{Trade (Alchemist)} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.Ml6ZblglcSbVhXyh]{Trade (Smith)} (or anyone really, as long as they know how to properly melt metal and cast using moulds, with the exception being @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shots}).

  • Shots can be crafted in batches of 12 times their listed quantity (so 144 of @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.Bjewc1ehUeeQTnXs]{Bullet} in a batch, but only 12 of @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shot}).

  • They are being crafted by melting the raw metal and casting.

  • Raw metal costs 1/4th of the ammunition price. (easier to just multiply by 3 if you craft full batch)

    • Or can be prepared by an Alchemist beforehand

  • Process takes 3 hours.

  • Make an Average (+20) Trade (Alchemy or Smith)Â to see if you succeeded. Every +1 SL allows you to cast 5% more shots up to bonus of 20%

Casting @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shot} requires good quality mould, which is a @Pay[10gc]{10 GC, Rare} item, that could be prepared by an @UUID[JournalEntry.4spGTAnh7qc2JDqY.JournalEntryPage.TwuMMg4t9QPf89rT#mundane-alchemy]{Alchemist} in a week and a successful Hard (-20) Alchemy Test.

Other moulds cost @Pay[1gc]{1 GC, Scarce} and can be made by an Alchemist or a Smith by spending a day of work and a successful Average (+20) Trade Test.
